{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3423843,"name":"Kiet Chau","username":"kiettyyyy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kiettyyyy/{size}/194009_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-15T04:45:02.217Z","cooked":"

It’s finally here! After months of development based off of community input, we finally have the 1.2.0 firmware release along with some additional goodies to help out offseason hosts.

Please check the links below.

https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/miscellaneous/firmware-releases
https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/miscellaneous/firmware-changelog

image1372×1236 79.1 KB

image1666×1314 138 KB

1.2.0 Release Notes

  • Bug fixes
    • Critical - Fixed potential lockup on power events
      • Issue discovered where a power event prevented the radio from exiting the bootloader
    • Security - Fixed xxxxxx Subsystem
      • Processing maliciously crafted content may lead to data corruption or unauthorized data disclosure (Reported by Vivid-Hosting Threat Research and Jamie Sinn)
  • Radio Variant
    • Adds connection quality icon in the configuration page header
    • Adds connection statistics when in Access Point mode (allows for at home RF validation - Validating RF Performance | FIRST FRC Radio)
    • Adds SSID prefix that applies to both 2.4GHz and 6GHz SSIDs
    • Improved third party device compatibility with 6 GHz when in Access Point mode
    • This firmware image is the release candidate for the 2025 season
  • Access Point Variant
    • Fork of VH-113 firmware 1.2.0
    • Increased bandwidth limit to 7 Mbps
    • Added Web UI for ease of configuration
    • Added channel scan capability
    • Adds connection statistics

Bonus release:

VH-109 to Almost VH-113 Firmware

image1524×668 40.1 KB

Here’s the screenshot of the Access Point (VH-109 acting like a VH-113) config page

image1426×1450 153 KB

(edit: forgot to include the new RF validation guide under the “Practicing at Home” section)

Appreciate all the work you and your team have been putting into these radios and firmware upgrades, and the transparency you’re providing.

We’ve been toying with this… Cheesy Arena running on our VH-113 AP combined with a low cost Netgear managed switch. Imagine the possibilities!!!

bdaroz:

Happy to see this here… you know… for reasons.

I decided to throw a VH-109 configured in AP mode placed in the data closet at the other side of my house (shooting through many walls) and another VH-109 hooked up as a bridge feeding my laptop.

Something I would like to add, is it possible to add a section in the “Practicing at Home” section of the documentation to include how to setup a full field like setup, 6 Ethernet cables, 1 for each driver station, etc. Or maybe, that could be a Cheesy Arena documentation update. Hopefully we will learn more after Chezy Champs!
My team is eagerly waiting for the chance to have a FMS setup at home with Cheesy Arena Lite.

Edit: This would also be great to collab with @kylelanman Rootbeer PLC and/or @Jaci’s JMS. Being able to have affordable at home PLC setups is amazing! Really love Vivid-Hosting actively making this radio better is every single way!

We just got our radio…we were trying to program it and use it much like the old radio. And we got nothing. Doesn’t connect to the laptop. Doesn’t even show up on the wifi board for the laptop as a team radio.

IF I am reading things correctly…we need an AP of some flavor to run the bot for practice? IF so, it makes it difficult for team that don’t have a permanent field or area for practice.

IF there is a workaround for this…can someone point me in the right direction…Please and Thank You!!!

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":61,"updated_at":"2024-09-17T01:15:50.092Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":512,"readers_count":511,"score":132.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":471258,"topic_slug":"vivid-hosting-vh-109-1-2-0-firmware-release","display_username":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48664,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 5503"},"post_url":"/t/vivid-hosting-vh-109-1-2-0-firmware-release/471258/7","custom_user_title":"Mentor 5503","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424347,"name":"Jared Hasen-Klein","username":"jaredhk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaredhk/{size}/248125_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-17T01:35:05.903Z","cooked":"

You can do this. Instructions here: https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/getting-started/usage/practicing-at-home#id-2.4ghz-access-point

Connectivity Diagram

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":61,"updated_at":"2024-09-17T01:35:05.903Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":499,"readers_count":498,"score":189.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":471258,"topic_slug":"vivid-hosting-vh-109-1-2-0-firmware-release","display_username":"Jared Hasen-Klein","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/getting-started/usage/practicing-at-home#id-2.4ghz-access-point","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Practicing At Home | FIRST FRC Radio","clicks":26}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":48664,"username":"RicDV","name":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ricdv/{size}/188502_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":24866,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/vivid-hosting-vh-109-1-2-0-firmware-release/471258/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424348,"name":"paulonis","username":"paulonis","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/5fc32e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-17T01:45:50.746Z","cooked":"

See the Vivid Hosting Programming Your Radio page. Follow the directions for Team Client/STA mode. Note that to put DIP switch #3 into the on position, you’ll have to find it by removing the sticker covering the DIP switches on the bottom of the radio. Note also that your laptop will need to be looking for 2.4 GHz wi-fi. There is no 5 GHz option with the new radio.

The recommended way to use the new radio is with a dedicated, separate access point, but Client/STA mode with DIP switch #3 ON is a workaround to have the radio act as an access point like the old radio. There are warnings that this mode will be unreliable if used in a congested 2.4 GHz wireless environment and some teams have reported problems. I used the new radio in client mode all summer in a fairly uncongested wi-fi environment and found it to be solid. YMMV.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":61,"updated_at":"2024-09-17T02:00:01.078Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":481,"readers_count":480,"score":131.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":471258,"topic_slug":"vivid-hosting-vh-109-1-2-0-firmware-release","display_username":"paulonis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/getting-started/usage/programming-your-radio","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":13}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22261,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/vivid-hosting-vh-109-1-2-0-firmware-release/471258/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424359,"name":"","username":"httpmaster","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/h/ebca7d/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-17T02:22:51.708Z","cooked":"
kiettyyyy:

Here’s the screenshot of the Access Point (VH-109 acting like a VH-113) config page

In the docs it says:

  • VH-113 FW does not include a DHCP server by default. Users need to ensure that the 10.XX.YY.4 IP is reachable on the respective VLAN

Does this mean that you have to configure DHCP similar to what Chezy Arena does? Is it possible to plug into an unmanaged network switch and have a bunch of desktops connect (not isolating the VLANs)?

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":61,"updated_at":"2024-09-17T02:24:21.523Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":451,"readers_count":450,"score":100.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":471258,"topic_slug":"vivid-hosting-vh-109-1-2-0-firmware-release","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67339,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1836 team captain"},"post_url":"/t/vivid-hosting-vh-109-1-2-0-firmware-release/471258/10","custom_user_title":"1836 team captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424377,"name":"Thad House","username":"Thad_House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-17T05:34:18.452Z","cooked":"

Kind of adding onto the prior question, it says the VH-113 doesn’t include a DHCP server by default. But does that mean theres a way to enable one?

If not, is there a way to enable that 7 MBps bandwidth limit on the VH-109 firmware in access point mode? Having the same blocks that exist on the field exist in home mode is extremely important, and the VH-113 requiring an external DHCP server makes that much more difficult for just single team use.

Also if not, the docs page saying home use can just use the VH-113 by itself is just plain wrong, and needs to be corrected.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":61,"updated_at":"2024-09-17T05:40:31.109Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":417,"readers_count":416,"score":123.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":471258,"topic_slug":"vivid-hosting-vh-109-1-2-0-firmware-release","display_username":"Thad House","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16147,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 2025 VOTY"},"post_url":"/t/vivid-hosting-vh-109-1-2-0-firmware-release/471258/11","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 2025 VOTY","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424378,"name":"Kiet Chau","username":"kiettyyyy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kiettyyyy/{size}/194009_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-17T05:34:49.986Z","cooked":"
httpmaster:

Does this mean that you have to configure DHCP similar to what Chezy Arena does? Is it possible to plug into an unmanaged network switch and have a bunch of desktops connect (not isolating the VLANs)?

Yes, unless you just want one SSID, you don’t have to run the AP firmware variant.

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":61,"updated_at":"2024-09-17T06:43:03.804Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":2,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":384,"readers_count":383,"score":171.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":471258,"topic_slug":"vivid-hosting-vh-109-1-2-0-firmware-release","display_username":"Fletcher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25039,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between."},"post_url":"/t/vivid-hosting-vh-109-1-2-0-firmware-release/471258/14","custom_user_title":"FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between.","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424401,"name":"Kiet Chau","username":"kiettyyyy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kiettyyyy/{size}/194009_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-17T06:44:20.213Z","cooked":"
Thad_House:

Having the same blocks that exist on the field exist in home mode is extremely important

So, teams should have a Windows Server with the DHCP service running? I think that’s pretty prohibitive.

Instead we disabled the DHCP server as it’d have to run on all VLANs and leave it for outside implementation. An access point should be an access point and nothing more, allowing for integration into official FMS, Cheesy Arena, JMS, etc.

If you want the easy button implementation, don’t run the 113 firmware release and just configure the 109 as an access point. It’s already built into the radio. It gives you the DHCP server feature with a bonus of a 6 GHz radio!

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":61,"updated_at":"2024-09-17T06:44:20.213Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":379,"readers_count":378,"score":115.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":471258,"topic_slug":"vivid-hosting-vh-109-1-2-0-firmware-release","display_username":"Kiet Chau","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":"Vivid-Hosting","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/5/0/50d2e846f0add7aa9489092abe0f436644dde98d.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":62,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6398,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"CEO @ Vivid-Hosting, Mentor @ Team 1538 / The Holy Cows"},"post_url":"/t/vivid-hosting-vh-109-1-2-0-firmware-release/471258/15","custom_user_title":"CEO @ Vivid-Hosting, Mentor @ Team 1538 / The Holy Cows","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424412,"name":"Ryan Blue","username":"Ryan_Blue","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_blue/{size}/174016_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-17T07:51:45.536Z","cooked":"

I think leaving the AP variant as close to an on-field config as possible is fine. Thad was just requesting that there be an option to enable the bandwidth limit on the “radio” variant when in AP mode, and I agree. That’s a pretty big thing that teams will absolutely run into issues with… “Well my camera stream worked at home, why is the field causing issues?”

I also agree that if the VH-113 is going to be the first thing recommended to teams for “practicing at home”, it should be usable on its own without any gotchas or pitfalls (no vlans, dhcp enabled). If not, put it on the page after the vh-109 and document the limitations clearly.

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":61,"updated_at":"2024-09-17T08:01:54.595Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":15,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":374,"readers_count":373,"score":164.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":471258,"topic_slug":"vivid-hosting-vh-109-1-2-0-firmware-release","display_username":"Ryan Blue","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":6398,"username":"kiettyyyy","name":"Kiet Chau","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kiettyyyy/{size}/194009_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/vivid-hosting-vh-109-1-2-0-firmware-release/471258/16","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424422,"name":"Thad House","username":"Thad_House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-17T11:41:54.180Z","cooked":"

As Ryan said, I just want to be able to enable the bandwidth and any port blocks in AP Mode for the VH-109. That’d be plenty enough for me.

Additionally, the docs shouldn’t put the VH-113 at the top of the options for practicing at home. That page mentions nothing about needing a DHCP server. And suggesting to just set static IP’s is a terrible suggestion, as again that doesn’t match the field setup by default. From everything we’re reading, using the VH-113 for home use is impossible without a full FMS setup, which is way out of the realm of possibility for 99% of teams.

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":61,"updated_at":"2024-09-17T15:29:12.342Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":340,"readers_count":339,"score":68.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":471258,"topic_slug":"vivid-hosting-vh-109-1-2-0-firmware-release","display_username":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24866,"username":"jaredhk","name":"Jared Hasen-Klein","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaredhk/{size}/248125_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48664,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 5503"},"post_url":"/t/vivid-hosting-vh-109-1-2-0-firmware-release/471258/18","custom_user_title":"Mentor 5503","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424487,"name":"Fletcher","username":"FletcherS7","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletchers7/{size}/168995_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-17T16:13:34.597Z","cooked":"
Thad_House:

And suggesting to just set static IP’s is a terrible suggestion, as again that doesn’t match the field setup by default.

The field setup is designed to allow static IP configurations because mDNS can be unreliable. You will also find many FTA’s who recommend using a static IP configuration because it reduces points of failure and reduces the time to connect to the field if the DS for some reason becomes disconnected.
Here is the official documentation on configurating static IP’s for the field network.

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

IP Configurations

TE.AM IP Notation: The notation TE.AM is used as part of IPs in numerous places in this document. This notation refers to splitting your five digit team number into digits for the IP address octets...

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":61,"updated_at":"2024-09-17T16:13:34.597Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":17,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":356,"readers_count":355,"score":141.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":471258,"topic_slug":"vivid-hosting-vh-109-1-2-0-firmware-release","display_username":"Fletcher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/networking/networking-introduction/ip-configurations.html#on-the-field","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"IP Configurations — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":9}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25039,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between."},"post_url":"/t/vivid-hosting-vh-109-1-2-0-firmware-release/471258/19","custom_user_title":"FIRST California | FTAA, CSA, A/V, and everything between.","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424496,"name":"Thad House","username":"Thad_House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-17T16:28:53.883Z","cooked":"

I said by default. The suggestions made should allow the default setup to work. I know you can set static ips, I tell teams to do that all the time. But the recommended setup needs to support the default. Having the first thing in the docs require a non default setup is not great.

The vh-113 shouldn’t be at the top anyway because it’s a limited availability product. The top recommendation should be something actually obtainable and easily usable by teams. More advanced things should be lower.

made this mistake at first.
